intro: Fingerhuthia africana, commonly known as the African fingerhuthia, is a flowering plant native to sub-Saharan Africa. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton plants. The plant is characterized by its distinctive finger-like leaves and showy, trumpet-shaped flowers that range in color from white to pink. It typically grows in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in forest understories or along stream banks. Due to its ornamental value and ecological importance, it is sometimes cultivated in botanical gardens and conservation areas.
